channel.title: Hopefully I get a quick answer
channel.description: I need to know key IDs (for the keyboard, for those who dont know what i am talking about), and cant remember the website for it. Any help?

item.title: Hopefully I get a quick answer
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“gikid, post:2, topic:101301”][quote author=frankthetank link=topic=145269.msg1396412#msg1396412 date=1180489199]
I am getting really tired of windows. Can i run runescape on the system bios? or do i need a mouse running on the bios also?
[/quote]
[me=gikid]ties a rope around his neck and to the top of the golden gate bridge, then jumps off.[/me]

Ok, this isn’t even funny anymore. Playing Runescape in BIOS? What kind of noob are you? This is just pathetic. I think I know why Jamie left now.[/quote]

lol, you idiot. frankthetank = frank. He was making fun of semaphores completely ignorant comment.

Read full topic
item.source: Hopefully I get a quick answer

item.title: Hopefully I get a quick answer
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“frankthetank, post:6, topic:101265”][quote author=semaphore link=topic=145269.msg1394657#msg1394657 date=1180455206]
Those are synthetic keys that are processed by an OEM tiny-app that can either

[ul][li]Be running on the system bios*[/li]
[li]Be running on the os[/li][/ul]

  • = Most likely iirc.

The keys are processed by that small app and the desired functionality will occur. It is not the same for all brands and models of laptops. For example, my old laptop used page-up + page-down as the brightness. My current laptop uses the up and down keys (both with a special function key)
[/quote]
I did not know that you can run small tiny-app’s on the system bios.

I am getting really tired of windows. Can i run runescape on the system bios? or do i need a mouse running on the bios also?[/quote]
If you can:

[ul][li]Convert the JVM to be 100% Native[/li]
[li]Fit the 200 MB Behemoth in[/li]
[li]Be able to consider a 200 MB application “small”[/li]
[li]Make keyboard, mouse, HDD, and Display, abstraction layers[/li][/ul]

Then yes, you totally can.

Read full topic
item.source: Hopefully I get a quick answer

  • = Most likely iirc.

The keys are processed by that small app and the desired functionality will occur. It is not the same for all brands and models of laptops. For example, my old laptop used page-up + page-down as the brightness. My current laptop uses the up and down keys (both with a special function key)[/quote]
I did not know that you can run small tiny-app’s on the system bios.

I am getting really tired of windows. Can i run runescape on the system bios? or do i need a mouse running on the bios also?
